inn1.comm: short, wide, and that's crashed away on one knee behind point
plenty of shape away - but you can have too much of a good swing, and that's gone wide
overstepping and that's driven nicely through mid-off for the first boundary
driven to mid-on and there's some confusion between the Pakistan batsman as Johnston slides over to pick that up
a hint of swing away has the batsman squaring up and then hiding his bat behind his pad on the front foot
another good delivery, false shot, a little bit of a dab at that one, feet trapped in the crease
nice arc of away swing there, full, and the batsman attempts to drive it to mid-off

gone! Ireland strike and there's cheers all round the ground. Jubilation for Langford-Smith with a classic paceman's delivery, banana swing away and that clips the outside edge, Niall O'Brien takes an easy catch. Great start for the Irish and there's a conga going on already (in the stands that is)

oh, and that's hurt Imran, a straight ball rising slightly and that takes the edge of the bat, clattering into his pelvis above his left leg. Ouch. The physio runs on. Speaking of running, there was a whole gaggle of fielders waiting to swoop on that one - Ireland are well up for this
slower ball, on leg, and the man rushes in from short square leg
ah! A flashingly thick outside edge just evades the outstretched fingertips of a leaping second slip
good reply from Rankin, banging that one in past the outside edge just outside off
the bowler stands tall and brings that one down from a great height, the ball pitching outside off and carrying on through to the keeper down the off-side channel
a touch too short and wide and that's helped down to wide third man off the back foot
ooh, a thin inside edge onto the pad was what stood between Imran and being out lbw, there
on middle-and-leg, the batsman bends over that one as he sends it to short square leg
a bit of a nothing ball, too wide outside off stump to be of interest, plenty of swing of course, and that arcs on its merry way through to the keeper
that one's fuller and straighter and the batsman leans into it in driving it to cover
straight and balloons into the air off the pad and, oh, that one ever so nearly ran onto the stumps, kicked away by Imran at the last minute
oh! Dropped. Imran clattered that one right back at Langford-Smith and the ball cannoned into his outstretched clasping right hand. Agony
wide down leg this time - no question on the call
right up there pitching on off and that's driven to mid-on
a very neat delivery, slinking right past Khan's outside edge at a fair height

gone! Good ball, banged in back of a length and pitching on off and catching out Khan, who sends a thick outside edge to first slip. Two wickets now for Pakistan and that's a big incision - Khan snapped up for a duck
down leg and Yousuf thinks about chasing that one down leg
Yousuf not comfortable there in fending that straight one down
worked to short midwicket
effortless from Yousuf, one of his signature shots that, a mere flick of an extra cover drive and that's the tension immediately undone
swing on that one, but fairly loose, and that's sweetly timed through cover
right up there and stoutly defended outside off
the bowler's delivery arm strayed loose a bit there, sending the ball down leg
much, much better - and that one nearly takes the edge. The arm was ramrod straight this time and the ball pops right up, almost cutting him in half as it cuts back. Lovely stuff
more aerial movement and this one is left alone outside off
zooms that one through the air again and that bends deliciously away from the righthander
let himself down again with another wide down leg
it's all going on: this time the ball pops up and a leading edge flies just short - about a metre or so - of the man at point and they scamper a quick single
another wide down leg and they're letting the pressure off with each and every extra
better - just placed on a good length outside off, wide enough to leave
short and straight but the batsman doesn't capitalise, trying to rush that off his hips to midwicket, not timing it
another wide, another one down leg. This is a shame
better, on off, and the batsman plays an unconvincing stroke to wide third man, his bottom hand flying up off the bat as he doesn't quite control it properly
good delivery, on the money outside off and plenty of late swing carrying it through to the keeper's right - extra bounce, but Yousuf happy to leave well alone
still struggling to control the swing - this one was too wide down the off this time
nice height, steepling past Yousuf's face and threatening to lick his grille
gentle delivery this time, just easing down the off-side channel and rising - like a Harmison ball - on its way through
aw, curiosity nearly killed the bat there - slashing away from his body with a cover drive that just fails to shave the edge
frustrating leg-side stuff once more
Imran gets bat on that but bounces into space behind the wicket
regulation line-and-length delivery forces the batsman to present the full face in a standard front-foot defensive
Andrew White's hurt his left hand at cover, diving to stop Imran's flashing cover drive. He shakes his hand in the air and carries on
big shout for lbw, but that one would have gone over - and there was a lick of an inside edge, too
slower delivery slightly misdirected and that's eased in front of midwicket
super ball, just back of a length and the bounce disconcerts the batsman who dangles his bat away from the body on the back foot
under pressure again and he slashes over that one with a cut shot that slices only air
short and pulled flat in front of midwicket, the batsman getting into a good position, picking up the length early and timing it well
flashes at that off the back foot, fishing high in the air, and so high and away from the body it's a wide
worked off the back foot to midwicket
worked off the back foot to midwicket
short and defended down off the back foot
driven to mid-on
worked into midwicket this time
wide down off - and that was almost worth two wides it was so wide
good ball left alone outside off
the bowler grunts with the delivery effort there and Yousuf leaves it alone outside off
Umpire Bowden thinks about calling a wide for that one down off, but lets the bowler get away with it
played on the front foot with a solid defensive
goes down leg and that's yet another wide - this has been a real downfall for Ireland so far
pushed up there, straight, and that's worked into the leg side, but not entirely convincingly
walks on to his back foot to nibble that one into the covers for a cheeky single

worked off the legs into midwicket and the batsmen have to be quick to make that tight single. Kevin O'Brien did well to race round from square leg, release quickly and nearly take the non-striker's end sticks, though Imran would have been safe
played down off the back foot
swings away down off and that's just to say wide - they all count, though
straight, back of a length, and Yousuf's not sure where the edge has gone as that crashes into him - the ball dribbled down square on the off side, safe enough
defended easily enough
good delivery and Yousuf can only defend that one
uppish drive but that's found the gap through point and there's some quick running for the two, but Yousuf declines a third so that he can retain the strike
a good ball, rising and swinging away from the righthander who leaves it
fuller, nearly yorker length, and that's well dug out off the toes, the batsman pressing forward into the shot
good delivery, short and the batsman does well to adjust for the swing and work it down away from the two slips
a mere flick of the wrist through midwicket brings up Pakistan's fifty
driven to short midwicket
played down off the back foot straight into the pitch, stunning the pace off the ball
well worked into the midwicket off the backfoot
swing on it and that pops harmlessly into the leg side
slower delivery worked to mid-on
Yousuf steals the strike back by following the ball round to leg
wide outside off, a loosener and let's hope that's all it is
much better line immediately, and that's left alone outside off
nearly a yorker and Yousuf creeps that one off his toes and to mid-on
driven to cover and that's a quick single
wide outside off and that's driven away strongly through cover
gottim! That's a big blow for Pakistan and a big strike for Ireland! A comfortable catch at backward point and there's a sort-of chicken dance celebration for Johnston
no-ball for overstepping
Inzamam strides nervously into that one and takes the single to cover
and now Botha strikes, removing Inzamam for just 1 run. Inzamam had barely looked comfortable last over when he came in and his dismissal was a fend down to first slip for a snappy catch, low.
straight and that pops into space on the leg side
driven slowly to mid-on
worked down off the back foot
right up there, but shaping towards the leg and that's just eased there
played strongly off the back foot to covers and that's a neat bit of nimble fielding, cutting off the runs
defended well on the front foot
glanced down leg with a short-arm jab
straight and eased to the man at midwicket
pitched right up there and driven to mid-off
wide and driven through extra-cover to get off the mark
right on the money and that's defended forward strongly
defended on the back foot into the covers
defended on the back foot into the covers
worked off the back foot to mid-on
gosh, he nearly had him that time - great delivery rearing up a touch, cutting into him off the seam and how did that miss the outside edge? Nobody knows
dinked to point where yet another alert fielder scoops the ball up
tickled round fine and O'Brien does very well behind the sticks to dive wide to his left to cut off the runs
"Hooowawa" shouts the bowler but the tone of his voice trails off - that one pitching outside the line
defended forward quietly enough
left alone outside off this time
risky single to backward point, dabbed down, and a winged-in underarm nearly takes the one stump in view - the batsman was well in, though
Johnston pushes the ball through - using every ounce of his energy here - and it flies on a good length to the keeper
just wide again - the extras marching upwards; that's 17 now
lovely shot, got to be happy with that one, a straight drive back past the bowler

oh, Botha really causing all kinds of problems now. Imran went for a loose waft outside off, his head coming up and his eyes leaving the ball - that was a good length and he should have dealt with it differently
well bowled, slower delivery and the batsman decided, only at the last minute, to pull out of the swipe
more quiet defence - enjoyable stuff from Botha
another flash, this one missing the under edge, but only just, and a snick can't be far off at this rate
gentle looper outside off and the batsman makes the firm decision to leave that one alone
he's done him this time! Well, as just mentioned, it really was coming. Imran prodded on that shot, tentative and the edge pops off on its inevitable trajectory to first slip
left alone outside off
jaffa just evades the outside edge
down leg
that's better - he adjusts to come down off this time, but has ever so slightly overcompensated and as such the ball can be easily left alone
down leg again - the batsman gamely chases it round but the umpire still reckons it's too far away from him to be a valid delivery
comes forward to prod that one to cover
straight and defended on the back foot
decent line and length to finish the over with defence
dealt with with a foist to cover
shoulders arms early and forcefully
another well executed ball and I bet Botha wishes there was no limit on his overs - he's really in the groove here
Akmal defends this one tidily
slower one deceives Akmal who's already through the shot and so sends it uppish - but in space - to cover
gets that one past the batsman who's looking uncomfortable here
testing stuff first up from O'Brien, who tempts the batsman by floating one down on his toes and he nearly plays straight back to the bowler
first misfield of the day - a nice off-drive dinked with great timing past the fielder, who gets half a hand on it but not enough to take the pace off it
and he strikes with his third ball! Unbelievable work out there from the Ireland team - and brother O'Brien takes the snick behind the sticks
driven square to point
snapped up tidily in front of point - that's really great work from the consistent Irish fielders
the batsman can only defend
yet another dot ball from Botha there, just outside the off stump with a lovely curving Monroe-esque shape
the batsman comes forward to try to get bat on it; he does, and that's just a wishful half-shout for lbw
squirts that in at the batsman on a good length and that's defended
driven to cover this time - the batsmen still can't get Botha away and they actually seem afraid to even try
a run! Botha has spoiled his figures, there. That's worked off the back foot behind point
dabbed at, that one arcing slightly, and it's nearly wicket-time once more
left alone outside off
unconvincing crash into the foot this time
good line and length again
gets away with a low full toss on leg which can only be guided to mid-on
defended this time
played off the back foot to the man on the wide third man boundary
another dot from the nagging Botha
well defended
ooh, bump ball as that's crashed to cover who plucks it from the air and the crowd are momentarily excited
driven square in front of point for a collector's single off Botha
slower ball, loops in dangerously, but the batsman is solid in defending right over that one
dribbled into the leg side
thinks about chasing that one on the off-side but lets it fly through to O'Brien
stabs at that one and it pings through to the keeper without kissing the edge
driven into his front foot
on leg and that's driven to mid-on
a rare attacking shot... and indeed that's a boundary... good shot deliberately send high over the slips and on
driven in front of midwicket
driven to short mid-on, rolling along the floor
too good and Botha just misses out on another, a leg cutter squaring Mahmood up all ends
driven to cover
a good line and length coming into the righthander and he manages to jam his bat down to trap the ball
safe, aerial drive over mid-on
driven slowly to cover
aggression from the batsman with a straight, well-struck drive,  but O'Brien is equal to the task and stops the run
down on one knee and strikes that hard towards cover and it goes over the top and all the way
driven out on the off-side for a quick single
pushed up there and the big bowler does well to bend right down and get his left hand down on the ball
good shot - hit easily round down through fine leg
a thick outside edge flies down into space through third man
driven slowly to cover
good delivery, a bit of bounce and that turns away from the righthander
that one turns in this time and the batsman can only defend that one
worked off the legs into midwicket
defended off the back foot into the off side
defended down this time and that's a good first over from McCallan
flicks that off the legs down to orthodox fine leg
left alone outside off stump, that one rising on its way through to O'Brien
tries to bang that one in short, it doesn't really get up and that's worked down behind point
straight and there are loud, but late, shouts for lbw - it was too high, though
driven to gully this time and that's well fielded by Porterfield who knows what's at stake here
worked to midwicket
crashed off the back foot to just inside the off-side sweeper boundary
comes forward and defends right over that one
delicately played, deliberately uppish through the vacant slip area and that brings up the hundred for Pakistan
lobbed up through fine leg
dabbed to midwicket for a quick single
worked well off the back foot to mid-on
wide down leg - and quite high, too
ooh, good delivery, sharp and it reared up from an awkward length, crashing into the batsman's gloves

should be out... high and that's taken by Johnston at midwicket, who's made another good decision in bringing back his premier bowler. That was a silly shot from Mahmood and what was looking to be a threatening partnership has been broken. Pakistan are in deep trouble now
another wide, on the leg side, and that's not good enough
that's the 20th wide this innings, and that's on the leg side
jabbed down awkwardly off the back foot

"What a catch!" screams the entire office - and indeed it was, Johnston running back from mid-on and taking that over his shoulder. Poor shot to one which got big on him, and he mistimed a pull, sending a leading edge over to the captain who winds himself in diving flat on the ground. He won't mind, though. Akmal does - crashing the bat into his pads in disgust as he walks off, chuntering to himself
dabs that one down into short midwicket and the batsmen shuffle through, Sami eager to retain the strike
on the money and driven to cover
defended on the front foot into the cover region
dabbed out behind point
rushes through to the keeper
on leg and that's tickled fine off the pads
played off the back foot into the covers
shuffles across his stumps to take that from straight and into the leg side
that rises on its way through to the keeper
that one keeps low and it's defended down
more quiet defence
straight as a die and that's worked down off the back foot, quietly again
a straight bat to that one which flies off the face into the covers
just a touch too straight, but an awkward length and the batsman bends over it in defence
pitches on leg and there's another good piece of fielding, with a diving slide from mid-on
a quick single down off the back foot into the covers
on leg and that's picked off the toes nicely, but straight to the fielder
slower delivery, dies on the pitch, and it's controlled down to third man but Morgan does well to dive on to it and return it quickly
plenty of away swing, but a touch loose and Sami drives out to cover, where it's cleanly tidied up
short and played down well off the back foot
defended down into short midwicket
steepling bounce from back of a length, but wide enough to leave
slightly slower ball and that's just defended over
veered too much down the off side
left alone outside off
chased down leg
defended down
defended forward
driven to mid-on
yet another wide - this one drifting down off
defended forward with a solid, straight bat
on the money and that's another solid defence
pushed right up there and that's defended again
shot! Hit straight and sweet right over mid-on and that's a welcome four for Pakistan
straight and defended off the back foot
driven to mid-on
wobbling threateningly in the air and that's defended over into the leg side
strides out to drive that through the covers but doesn't get the ball fullin the middle of the bat
tempting swing again, drawing him into flashing a wide drive into that one
flings that one down on a good length and that's well left by Rao
drawn outside the off stump again and that's a tidy over there
right up there and the keeper shouts "Get that, get that" forcefully to the point fielder, who indeed does get that
defended down on the front foot this time and they squeeze out a run
driven without much power into the off side on the front foot
oh, nearly broke through there with a half-shout for lbw but there was a clear inside edge as that one squirted down to midwicket
defended forward this time
well worked to mid-on there and Johnston looks like he's in the wars there as he dives on that one and winces, but he's certainly still fighting hard with his troops
left alone outside off this time, with a gentle bit of swing away
defended forward, a much better shot
good delivery, forcing the batsman to tilt his head away from the shot as it flew past his shoulder, straight, and on to the keeper
short, and a wayward throw back in from the pull shot as that goes into midwicket - a direct hit at the non-striker's end would have had the batsman a long way out
worked behind point
dabbed to mid-on
defended first up
oh, a good shout for lbw, sweeping. That seemed to be going on to hit off and the umpire thought about it for a long time, before giving the batsman the benefit
defended forward this time
some good fielding in the covers this time
defended forward again
another good ball to round off a decent over
a nice shot, waited for that and played it late down to third man
driven into the covers
shapes that one in at the righthander who defends over it
driven to cover where it's stopped safely enough

could have been a run out there, that one dinked down to gully, Morgan unsure whether to run with the ball to the stumps or shy - he chose shy, the right decision, but missed the single stump he had to aim for
defended forward
defended into short midwicket
swept and there's a quick single
defended this time
tidy defence this time
quiet stuff, defended once more
cuts in off the seam and there's not much Sami can do with that one
comes forward and nearly yorks himself in trying to work that off the toes
good shot, a nice dab off the back foot, cut down behind point
a huge shout, but the ball was drifting down leg and a quick leg-bye results
worked behind point for some more electric fielding, well cut off
Sami comes across his stumps to play that, but pushes a single into the off side now
gone! That's an important wicket for Ireland which will puncture the momentum this pair were building - swept up high to the deep backward square leg for what was made to look like an easy catch
defended forward
worked off the front foot into short midwicket
pops up off the bat to gully
worked off the back foot to midwicket
a quick single ends the over
outside edge and there's some momentary excitement before that bounces in front of Morgan who dives well to his right
windy whoosh and Gul steps back to have a think about that shot and regroup
left alone outside off stump this time
back of a length and Gul fancies driving that at cover, it goes ever so slightly uppish but no real danger
ooh, that zings in at the batsman and he's tempted to flash at it
driven straight to cover
defended quietly
worked into the covers
a good bit of loop there but Gul comes forward to get over it
that's it! Gul has gone. He went for the slash over to deep midwicket but it fell too short and the fielder waited under it for a while before taking the catch safely

inn2.comm: confident start, steered through fourth slip, all along the ground, quite safe, and a massive cheer from the Irish supporters. Every run will be greeted as keenly as an Irish winner in the Gold Cup ...
short of a length, the batsman goes back and gets right into line
too full, driven to midwicket and an easy single
fired in full on leg stump, blocked back to the bowler and jeers as he ponders hurling it back at the batsman
bat and pad jammed together in a jerky forward defensive stroke, the ball trickles into the covers
again bat and pad as one, and the ball squirts to point who makes a sprawling stop
nice, just short, quick (88mph) and that trampolined through to Akmal who took it at throat height
leg side, looping off the pad behind square and a few gasps as the Pakistan supporters momentarily thought it might have been a catch
swinging into the left hander at 90mph, Bray aims an expansive drive and plays outside it ... it also did him for pace
leg side again, wraps Bray on the thigh pad - it again seemed to be through him when he played it - and bobbles down to long leg. A run given ... not sure how

a loud and raucous yell for leg-before as a yorker spears in at leg stump, it hit Porterfield on the foot but again the umpire gave the run as the ball squirted out on the leg. Hawkeye says that was out and it certainly was ...
good ball, batsman into line and blocks
hmm ... not confident but they all count. Bray forward and gets a big inside edge which skims to long leg.
Porterfield back on his stumps to block on the back foot
banged in short outside the off stump, Porterfield sways out the line as Gul follows right through to underline the fact that he's going to give the batsman a working over
Gul follows up with a good-length ball on off stump which is confidently pushed into the covers
defended, slightly on the move, and it bobbles to mid-off who manages to misfield a ball coming at him at snail's pace
deliberately steered between the slips and gully, Sami at third man attacks the ball and fires in a low throw to ensure there will be no second

inswinger which is through Bray before he can get a bat to it, pitched in line and ... was going over the top of the stumps says the much-loved Hawkeye. In fairness, Porterfield should have gone in Sami's previous over, so two blunders by Brian Jerling have evened themselves out
full on leg stump, clipped into the on side
full again, driven between mid-on and midwicket and loud cheers once more from the Irish
cover drive, all along the ground, not timed but it still had enough juice to beat the chasing pack
speared across Porterfield - with an accompanying snarl - and he leaves the ball
fractionally short and turned into the leg side
short and climbed on Morgan who kept it down as it wrapped him on the gloves, Porterfield called for the run and although Morgan was slow out of the blocks, he made it with ease
outside off stump and left well alone
jaffer ... seamed away from the left hander who was well beaten by a ball which did far too much
and another one, the only criticism being it was too short, and the batsman was able to whip the bat out of the way on length alone
good length and blocked, Gul again snarls and snorts his way towards the batsman after the shot is played
and a third peach (sorry to mix fruits) which spits across Porterfield but, once more, just too short, so the batsman could leave on length instead of having to consider playing at it
loud and passionate appeal for leg-before - Sami almost begging - pitched on off and hit him outside the line and it would have gone on to miss
Morgan back to one at 89mph and he had to hurry to get his bat onto that and drop it into the pitch safely

that's out, and it was a goner before the finger went up. Lovely bowling, on middle, swung so it would have gone on to hit the middle peg two-thirds up. It was through Morgan - he had seemed to be struggling with the pace  throughout his brief stay - and wrapped him on the front foot but he wasn't that far forward
pushed defensively into the off side
tucked behind square on the leg side
good length, swinging in to the left hander, blocked
good one, angled across the batsman and his weak spar misses the ball by some way
O'Brien up on his toes to push the ball into the off side
through O'Brien, who jumps like a cat on a hot tin thingy and is struck amidships for his pains
O'Brien airbourne again and once more is off his feet as the ball hits him high on the pads. Gul follows through to give him some advice
tucked off the legs to the right of midwicket and it has enough oomp to allow them to come back for the second. Gul is bowling well but too short ... he's wasting the new ball
too much width outside the off stump, O'Brien steers the ball to the right of a sliding point
far too short and wide as well, O'Brien steps back and smacks that through the covers and it's four all the way. Inzamam scowls as well he might ...
great response from Sami at around 90mph, O'Brien drives loosely off the back foot and is beaten all ends up
pushed on the bounce into the covers and well fielded, although the throw at the bowler's end was less impressive
full, swinging and on the button, well defended to mid-on

full outside leg stump, O'Brien across and it appeared to clip his pads on its way through and Akmal took it well, low to his right. Jeers from the Irish spectators who thought that should have been a wide
sweet off drive, no effort and almost no follow through, but timed well enough to beat mid-on who had to chase it all the way to the rope
outside off stump, no shot, no drama
good length and line, O'Brien jumps back and jabs down on it just in time
O'Brien into line and safely plays it into the off side

oh yes, take that! Full outside off stump and quite superbly driven all along the ground past mid-on, who is reduced to the role of ball fetcher. Brian Lara could not have hit that better or more sweetly
good reply from the bowler, short outside off stump
O'Brien back, and he whips the ball off his pads at the last moment and down to long leg

short and slashed over the slips, it bounces a yard in front of Gul at third man, he misfields but leaps back to stop the ball a yard from the rope. The batsmen thought that was going for four and so stopped running. Good recovery from Gul ...
another rasping off drive, but this time the fielder is in the right place and so saves himself a long walk to the rope
outside off and left alone
short, but even so got big and Porterfield did well to keep that down from in front of his face
Porterfield again forced onto his toes to get over the ball and run it into the gully area
he went for it but it was a yard too full and a foot too wide
he starts with a leg-side wide to loud and sarcastic cheers from the Irish
better line, around off stump and patted into the off side
O'Brien back and blocks
good one, just outside off stump and through the backward defensive jab
through to the keeper, no shot needed
O'Brien turns that into the leg side, the runs needed are now under 100
Porterfield into line and meets the ball with the full face of the bat
very short and an attempt to swish the ball over the slips misses. How was that not a wide?
no doubts about that one as Sami almost seemed to be daring the umpire to call the side. The umpire obliges ...
tip and run up to mid-off, good quick calling
short of a length outside off stump. It's a dot ball but it's not really the best use of the hard ball as they need wickets if they are to win this
dropped short and fast and right into the batsman's chest, Porterfield fends it down to the right of Hafeez at short leg ...but he can't hold on to the ball at full stretch
more tip-and-run, that could have been close but Shoaib running in from cover didn't pick the ball up cleanly
short, the hook shot ended up being hurried and uncontrolled as he almost turned his head away, but he got away with it as the ball arced well to the right of long leg
firm drive back at the feet of the bowler who is down quickly to pick it up
swinging, but it started too far outside the off stump to interest anyone
driven straight, Hafeez at mid-off dives to his left but cannot pick it up cleanly and the ball bobbles far enough away from him to allow the single
more loud cheers ... Billy B signals the wide as the bowler veered to the off
lovely ball, through the drive ... he was beaten all ends up by that one
swinging in to the batsmen, and as a result the drive went more to leg than Porterfield intended and the ball ended up with mid-on
too wide to tempt
good line and length, driven to mid-on
driven to mid-on again
inconclusive backward defensive, a bit late, and the ball bounces into the pitch and past his leg stump
loud shout for leg-before, beaten by the inswing, and that looked more out than Bray's earlier
even more confident shout but this one was heading well over the top. Pressure on the batsman and the umpire
short and through Porterfield who swishes nevertheless
loosener outside off and left alone
swinging towards leg stump, nicely clipped off his toes and a long chase for the man at midwicket to get the ball out near the square-leg boundary
that's so demoralising for the field ... dropped at his feet and a single. O'Brien collided with Nazir as he completed the run ...
pushed to mid-on ... it's getting a  bit dark here now
half-timed drive to short extra cover
wide on a length and Porterfield aims an expansive and overambitious slash at the ball and gets nowhere near it
safely negotiated
O'Brien back to block, sets off for a single but after two paces realises there's nothing on and he checks and yells "no"
short and on leg stump, thuds into O'Brien's thigh pad and an easy single, even though midwicket ran in and underarmed his throw into the stumps
short of a length. an indeterminate swish off the back foot which misses
flicked uppishly but it drops just short of  midwicket who started in but realised it was not going to carry and so checked to make sure he didn't miss it
checked drive which shoots back to the left of the bowler ... not a catch but it caused a few flutters among the faithful
pushed gently to point
neat running, blocked drive to mid-on and both batsmen off like hares. It's hard to defend that. The throw hit the bat and shot off into the wilderness but the batsmen didn't look to take advantage
outside off stump, a late but conclusive leave
another stolen single into the covers. This is the kind of thing that can really sap morale, especially in a low-scoring match
wide, badly-timed drive off the back foot goes nowhere
back and into line, well bowled and well played
that one beat the batsman's outside edge, no leave there
Porterfield takes a step and a half towards that, misses and is stuck on the thigh
punched off the back foot to extra cover
rather ambitious Caribbean-style slash off the back foot  ... if he had hit it that would still be going ... but he didn't
nurdled just wide of midwicket
driven to Yousuf at mid-on, he picks up and throws, hitting the stumps, but it was so clearly in that even the umpire didn't call for assistance from on high
two steps, blocked past the close man and a quick single. Inzamam hurls the ball at the stumps, misses and there are overthrows as the ball cannons off Yousuf's ankle
loud yell as it hits the pads, but no dramas
too short and sublime cut through point.
blocked
outside off, missed sweep and Akmal demolishes the stumps even though the back foot was well anchored
good line and length, a sniff of spin, and blocked
chopped into the off, well stopped by a wrong-footed Nazir
off the bat and then pad into the leg side, a moment's hesitation and although midwicket scored a direct hit, O'Brien was well home
outside off, no shot
back and slightly hurriedly blocked
neatly worked to mid-on with soft hands, all the pace off the ball and an easy run
speared into Porterfield's midriff, Mahmood follows through and the batsman and bowler exchange some opinions on life in general and that delivery in particular
thumped with real oomph back over the spinner's head ... two steps and crack
pushed to cover
cut, a tad uppishly, to point
back and pushed to cover
one big stride and turned to square leg, briefly thought about a second but settled for one
a key wicket. Hafeez pushed that one through, Porterfield went back and got a thick inside edge into his leg stump. Pakistan spot a glimmer of hope but there's a long way to go ...
neatly flicked to square leg, a long chase for the man at long leg and he just catches the ball inside the rope
cheers and jeers as the umpire calls a wide
O'Brien pushed the ball to mid-off, sets off as he calls "no" and a bit of confusion
thick outside edge through third slip
swinging delivery heading down the leg side, smacks the pads as Botha tries to flick the ball through midwicket
Botha into line, all very textbook
straight and blocked
O'Brien uses his feet to drive to mid-on
another big step and driven through the covers
he stays creasebound this time and blocks
good footwork again, he meets the ball on the half volley and works it through midwicket
pushed defensive shot to cover
Botha back and rather hurriedly pushed to backward point
short, O'Brien jerks his head out of the way and grins at Sami who doesn't return the smile
short and fast aimed at O'Brien's throat, eh gets over it well and guides it down to point. More verbals from Sami who seems to have been taking lessons from Andre Nel ...
fuller, driven to mid-off but he didn't get his foot to the pitch of the ball and so got no power in the shot
even shorter and O'Brien ducks, Sami follows right through so he stands face to face with the batsman. Good histrionics, but Pakistan need a wicket not a show pony
wide and smacked to third man

great reflect catch by Hafeez at short leg but a simply appalling decision, about as bad as you will see in this tournament and at such a crucial stage. The ball was heading down leg, Botha jammed his bat into the left side of his front leg and the ball hit the right and flew to short leg. Much appealing and shouting and after a long delay, the finger went up
turned behind on the leg side, a hurried single and the batsman beats the direct hit
outside off, left alone
rather hurried and jerky backward defensive block
short and well down the leg side. Gul looks hard done by, but it was as clear a wide as you will see
good ball, banged into the batsman's midriff
back and blocked, the batsman not really sure where that went
again the batsman goes back to defend
pushed into the covers, the bounce takes it between cover and point who get in each others way
O'Brien jumps and blocks to short leg where Hafeez dives and stops it well
turned round the corner and loud and enthusiastic cheers as it brings up O'Brien's second ODI fifty
turned off leg stump and Hafeez at short leg makes a really good reflect stop to his right
short on off stump and well blocked
full toss, knee height, well played to mid-on. The light is not great and that can't have been easy for someone who hasn't been in the middle for that long to pick up
on his toes, played with soft hands down to third man through the wide open space in the slips
pushed to cover
short again, and O'Brien jumps to get right over the ball and ensure it is under control
and again short and at the body, and Jack-in-the-box O'Brien jumps and drops it into the leg side
short and wide, beautifully cut, the ball is threaded through a small gap between gully and backward point
Gul loses his line by switching and fires the ball down the leg side
good delivery which made O'Brien think
ludicrous wide way down the leg side. Sami looks at his footholds but he didn't slip, he just lost his bearings
short and followed with a hard stare. This is the kind of bowling guaranteed to get the umpires consulting about the light
slipped down the leg side but not called as it flicked something
wide outside the off stump, O'Brien misses with an expansive drive. How on earth did Jerling not call that as a wide. At least he's consistent in his inconsistency
O'Brien back and into line
full and O'Brien into line
seamed back into the right hander and struck him on the thigh pad, no appeal as it was going well over the top
slanted across the left hander and left
flipped behind square on the leg side to rapturous applause
outside off and no nibble from O'Brien
O'Brien back and pushed to cover, takes a big stride and then screams "no"
back and a hint of a thick edge as the ball scoots to gully
neatly worked into the leg side as the more set O'Brien milks the strike
right through the batsman, an inch outside off stump, lovely ball
O'Brien back and almost seemed surprised as he shaped to leave it, in the end he got over the ball and ran it down to third man
full and on off stump, safely blocked
good length on middle and off, pushed back up the pitch
short and wide, smacked firmly to third man to get him off the mark
inswinger on off stump, O'Brien into line to defend.
short and dropped towards point, a call for a single and Niall O'Brien had to throw himself full length to make his ground, although the throw missed
pushed to point, no run
sumptuous ... short and wide, hammered with real gusto through cover. He visibly puffed out his chest as he turned to stare down the bowler even before the ball crossed the rope
tighter line, left alone
firm drive to mid-off with a shout of "wait, wait"
a bit wider but full and O'Brien not interested in chasing that
pulled round the corner, a hint of bottom edge and pad in that, and cheers as the ball bobbles to long leg
pushed to point and a good, early yell of "no" from both brothers
a daft bouncer, so short the batsman did not have to duck, and Akmal's stare to the heavens told the story
wide and steered to third man, right over the top of that
slashed, a thick edge and the ball flies over the slips - none of whom move - and over the rope
oh yes, excellent response, just outside off stump and through the ponderous jab to Akmal
short, into the batsman's nether regions and the ball (white one) drops down at his feet and a quick call of "no" from the non striker
steered into the covers, the non striker came too far down the track and there was a moment of anxiety but a misfield ensured no upsets
back and across, safely played
hit firmly to cover
clipped wide of midwicket and to the left of mid-on
missed pull, comes of the shoulder and from there it scurries into the covers
played to point who is in quickly to scotch thoughts of a run
spun across the left hander, left alone
premeditated sweep, very fine, Gul makes a good sprawling stop right on the rope and a massive cheer as that brings up the hundred
driven back to the bowler who hurls the ball back with interest as O'Brien dives for safety
a no-ball from a spinner ... oh dear
solid defensive shot into the off side
oh yes indeed ... two big steps and O'Brien launches that over long-on and into the crowd. He really middled that ...

O'Brien uses his feet once too often, and to be overly critical he was nowhere near that, much more of a yahoo than anything that had gone before, and he was up the creek without a paddle as Akmal completed a simple stumping
pushed into the off side
too far down the leg side, off the hip to long leg
full on leg stump, and an explosion of noise as he clips the ball off his toes to the left of the man at long leg who cannot get round to save the four
pushed to mid-off
short, White seemed slow to pick it up and he could do no more than spoon the catch to Hafeez at short leg
Is it get out of jail time? McCallan goes back, is turned square and a thick edge is well taken low down by Younis Khan at second slip. Good bowling and a slick catch
back and across, blocked
nervous moments, kept out
short and very wide down the leg side ... massive outpouring of cheers and Sami shuts his eyes in anger with himself
good ball, straight and on a length, O'Brien back to block
driven weakly back and Sami down quickly to half stop and deflect the ball into the non striker's foot
pushed off the back foot into the covers, never a single there
full toss on leg stump. clipped to deep square leg who has stayed out
down the leg side - only just - but it's just enough for it to be called a wide
dripped into the leg side., the fielders converge like flies round a moldy sandwich, but the batsmen weren't looking for a run anyhow
pushed to leg, again not any interest in a single
good ball, on the button, O'Brien equal to it, back and across to defend
again well blocked. O'Brien has done well to stop the rot and as long as Ireland don't lose wickets, they will always be ahead on D/L.
prodded into the off side
he looked for the tip-and-run but the off-side field were wise to that and they were on the ball like panthers
outside off stump, a swing and a miss and a loud appeal, but it didn't seem to have found the edge and Gul didn't support his close men
tried to smack that to cover but didn't time it
outside off stump and another wild swing which he misses. You feel that Gul just needs to bowl it straight ...
short and Johnston works that confidently off his hips to long leg, a brief thought of a second but the fielder was onto it quickly
back and jabbed nervously into the off side
short but O'Brien misses a pull which would have been four had he hit it as the field had come in
Johnston prods that to extra cover
plopped up into space on the leg side, mid-on into field

bat-pad or pad-bat ... a loud and rasping appeal for leg-before from the bowler but Bowden not interested. It hit him in line but was possibly going over whatever order it hit in. Good shout though and those have been given on other occasions
huge cheer as the ball goes into the leg side and the batsmen scamper a single
short and O'Brien ducks rather than hooks
short and a trifle wide,  O'Brien stands tall and launches that between cover and extra cover, well timed and the fielders had no chance
full toss down the leg side, Akmal did really well to leap to his left and take that, it could easily have been five wides
firm drive to extra cover
great yorker, shades of Waqar in his pomp, but Johnston got his feet out of the way and somehow dug it out. Superb and absorbing cricket all round
worked down to third man
another good yorker but outside off stump, and again dug out
O'Brien back and over that, he did well as it got big on him but he was right on top of it
leg side, he looks to turn it round the corner but it's glove and thigh pad rather than bat ... they don't care, it's a run and that's all that matters to the Irish
forward defensive, kills the spin
steps but to cut but he misses it ... there's nobody in the deep on the off, just three in the ring
pushed to leg, it goes nowhere
forward and flicked round the corner but there's a man there on the one
worked past mid-on, there's a man in the deep so just the one. More cheers ...
fired in at off stump, squeezed to square leg
solid forward defensive shot, no risks with two needed
tip-and-run, Johnston was yards short if the throw from Nazir at cover had hit, but it wasn't close. The scores are tied
full, driven to mid-on
Johnston swings and clubs the ball out of the ground over long-on. The crowd go mad as Billy Bowden's bent fingers are raised aloft ...
